definition: to indicate or name by units or groups so as to find the total number of units involved : number
examples: Count the pages of the manuscript.

definition: to name the numbers in order up to and including
to include in a tallying and reckoning
to call aloud (beats or time units)
consider, account
to record as of an opinion or persuasion
to include or exclude by or as if by counting
to recite or indicate the numbers in order by units or groups
to count the units in a group
examples: She was interrupted while she was counting.

definition: to rely or depend on someone or something
examples: He counted on his parents to help with the expenses.

definition: add, total
examples: It counts up to a sizable amount.

definition: to have value or significance
examples: These are the people who really count.
His opinions don't count for much.

definition: to deserve to be regarded or considered
examples: a job so easy it hardly counts as work

definition: with more to come
examples: in business for 50 years and counting

definition: to count the number present
to look forward to as certain : anticipate
the action or process of counting
a total obtained by counting : tally
reckoning, account
consideration, estimation
allegation, charge, one separately stating the cause of action or prosecution in a legal declaration or indictment
a specific point under consideration : issue
the total number of individual things in a given unit or sample obtained by counting all or a subsample of them
the calling off of the seconds from one to ten when a boxer has been knocked down, â€” see also down for the count, take the count
examples: He took a count of nine before getting up.

definition: the number of balls and strikes charged to a baseball batter during one turn
score
examples: tied the count with a minute to play

definition: a measurement of the thickness or fineness of yarn by determining the number of hanks or yards per pound it produces
the number of threads per square inch in a cloth
a European nobleman whose rank corresponds to that of a British earl
